answers.question: Have you participated in a previous Gitcoin Grants Round? If so, please name the rounds or link the builder profile to prior rounds.

answers.answer: Our project enables ENS domains to manage records on Optimism, and we have also developed a gateway that every domain on the superchain can use.
answers.question: How does your project contribute significantly to the Ethereum network's infrastructure? Please provide specific examples and metrics if available.

answers.answer:
We have an innovative CCIP Gateway that automatically handles the L2OutputOracle migration to DisputeGame and adjusts to dispute game type changes without needing to deploy a new gateway and verifier smart contract, ensuring zero downtime during this major migration.

Moreover, a single instance of our gateway and verifier contract can manage an indefinite number of Superchain registrations in the Superchain registry without requiring separate deployments for each chain.
answers.question: Describe any pioneering development work in your project, particularly in enhancing privacy, interoperability, or user experience.

answers.answer: The issue is that ENS names are only available on the Ethereum mainnet. This means that migrating them to L2 or even creating a subdomain community on L2 requires significant effort. We simplify the process by offering the same developer experience on L2 as on L1, without the need to manage the complex CCIP gateway.
answers.question: What specific problems or challenges in the Ethereum ecosystem does your project address? How does your solution improve upon existing alternatives?

answers.answer: Grant will be used to maintain the gateway and for more outreach.
answers.question: Outline your project's roadmap and how the grant funds will be used to achieve your development goals.

answers.answer: Our project promote identity adoption on the Superchain ecosystems.
answers.question: How does your project contribute to the decentralization and security of the Ethereum network?

For any project deploying smart contracts on blockchain networks, please list all your deployer addresses and their corresponding blockchain networks. Use this format for each entry: [deployer_address], [chain_id]â€”for example, 0x123abc..., 42161 (This represents a deployer address on the Arbitrum network). Please include a separate line for each unique deployer address and blockchain combination.

project.title: Opti.Domains | Scale ENS to OP
project.description:
Opti.Domains has contributed to the development of the ENS Official OP CCIP Gateway following the post-fault proof merge breaking changes that affected earlier implementations. Our mission is to scale ENS on Optimism.

Pull Request: https://github.com/ensdomains/evmgateway/pull/36

Discussion on Forum: https://discuss.ens.domains/t/op-fault-proof-upgrade-break-op-verifier-and-op-gateway-implementation-in-the-evm-gateway/18973

Scaling ENS to OP Proposal: https://app.charmverse.io/op-grants/opti-domains-ens-l2-development-9893299892995353
